title.rendered: VIDEO: What is creativity at Halcyon?

content.rendered:
On Thursday 17 March, our community came together for a wonderful celebration of our Grade 12 Visual Arts students’ talents. Mina, Mia, Octavia, Thomas, Mika, Iona, Leo, Juju, Isabella, Avery, Matilde, and Max brought their finest and most inspiring pieces to Asia House. Not only were visitors treated to a beautiful display of paintings, sculptures, and unique multi-media pieces: they had the opportunity to hear our young artists explain their work firsthand. We were all inspired by the perspectives and ideas represented by the students’ unique work, and we are pleased to have seen so many students and parents enjoying their creativity. Thank you to the Asia House staff, Katie Limchaikul, Ms Rees, Ms Ahmad, Ms Dance, the exhibitors, and our community for working so hard to bring this special night together. 

We are delighted to share a new video displaying the wonderful artwork students create here at Halcyon, and showcasing the amazing pieces our Grade 12 Visual Arts students produced at this year’s art exhibition. 

We are also pleased to share that Halcyon alumnus Isaac Benigson visited Asia House to share his perspective on the role of creativity in our future and in Halcyon’s own school mission.

Click on the video to dive into our Class of 2022 IB DP Visual Arts Exhibition. Please ensure that your volume is turned up!
